snippet: While American Airlines recently incorporated separate fees into base fares, Southwest Airlines seemed to be going in the other direction.
abstract: Joe Sharkey On the Road column observes American Airlines is experimenting with new pricing option that eliminates potential penalty fee for changing flights for customers who pay extra for basic coach ticket; by contrast, Southwest Airlines, which has long bragged about having simple fare structures, has announced plans to increase its dependence on fees.
lead_paragraph: While American Airlines recently incorporated separate fees into base fares, Southwest Airlines seemed to be going in the other direction.

headline.print_headline: Added In or Left Out, Fees Remain the Focus
headline.seo: With Demand Dropping, Airlines Focus on Fees
headline.main: Added In or Left Out, Fees Remain the Focus
